intro: Velaea arguta, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Velaea arguta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
